mods.abstract: Oliver P. Merriman was an avid follower of Pittsburgh theatre. He built a large scrapbook collection that documents the history of the performing arts in Pittsburgh from the 1870s through the 1930s. It is organized into several broad categories and contains thousands of theatre programs, clippings, photographs, and other ephemera.

Oliver P. Merriman Scrapbook Collection, 1825-1942, CTC.1964.01, Curtis Theatre Collection, Special Collections Department, University of Pittsburgh

Oliver P. Merriman, 1866-1942, was a theater enthusiast who solicited materials and compiled a comprehensive and well organized collection of over 160 scrapbooks. The vast majority of these scrapbooks documented nearly a century of the performing arts in Pittsburgh. Merriman befriended theatre managers to help him collect programs for the performances that he could not attend and was also able to obtain programs from productions dating back to before the Civil War.
